See you there!

Well, we did that on Monday, April 18, at the school's Teacher Institute Day. The LHSEF awarded more than $43,000 in grants to benefit our students next year. And we couldn't do it without your support! Please consider furthering our mission by clicking the "Donate Now" button at the top of the page!

April 2016 · Lemont, IL ·

On Monday, April 18, the Lemont High School Educational Foundation awarded its annual grants at a ceremony with Lemont High School's faculty and staff. More than $43,000 was committed to fund programs to benefit Lemont students next year.

Lemont High School
November 13, 2015 at 4:09 PM ·

On Saturday, November 7, three Lemont High School teachers - Mike Beranek, Monica Johnson and Tim Leffler - presented at the Illinois Council for Exceptional Children Winter Convention. They discussed the school's innovative "STEM WOW" program, which brings together special education and regular education students in the study of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math). They had a great crowd and did a wonderful job talking about how the project has impacted all students involved. Thanks for representing LHS so well! #GoLemont

Teacher Appreciation Week message for Science teacher Scott Collins:

"Scott Collins is an excellent biology teacher. He puts a tremendous amount of work into providing biology lectures online that are very helpful to students. His study guides help students focus on the key points of complex biology topics such as cellular metabolism and other biochemistry topics. His freshman biology honors course covers material that is the same as college and graduate school courses. This is a great thing, because he is preparing students at Lemont HS to be successful on AP Biology and for college degrees in biology or other sciences. Lemont HS is lucky to have such a dedicated, excellent, intelligent teacher."

--Peter Rogers
